name: Mark of Doom
roleplaying: You feel you are a spent force, every ounce of strength has been drawn from you.
mechanical: You are under the effect of WEAKEN. This mark cannot be removed by Snake Oil.

name: Mark of the Chosen
roleplaying: You have been marked as the Chosen of a God.
mechanical: You respond to IDENTIFY as "Demigod". You are unable to change your religious alignment. Everywhere within your reach is considered Holy Ground. You may enter the Temple and while there commune directly with your God. This Mark cannot be removed, doubled or suppressed. If you are killed, inform the killer to see a ref.

roleplaying: You feel your soul connected to a great web of other lifeforms
mechanical: You may convert Vitality into Mana on a one-to-one basis.

name: Mark of the Scholar
roleplaying: You feel an insatiable sense of curiousity
mechanical: You may learn two Lesser Spells, which you may cast using Mana you have.

name: Mark of the Explorer
roleplaying: You feel confined by the Bastion and a desire to be free
mechanical: You may ignore the travel requirements on gate openings and do not count towards the number of permitted players. You still require a voyager token.

name: Mark of the Slayer
roleplaying: You feel the power of a the God's protection over you
mechanical: You may call IMPALE with a two handed weapon without expending any Might against any creature you have IDENTIFIED as Undead

name: Mark of the Knight
roleplaying: You have left your body behind for a higher more pure from of existence.
mechanical: You are immune to physical damage. You don't regain Vitality from Refresh. If this Mark is removed or your devotion is not to Brothvar you instantly die. When you die you disappear leaving no soul or body.

name: Mark of Family
roleplaying: You are confident in all of your religious convictions and find it hard to think ill of your family.
mechanical: When you take damage you gain one charge of FLAME that you can deliver via melee weapon. These charges are lost when you receive a REFRESH.

name: Mark of Nightmare
roleplaying: You feel twitchy and anxious
mechanical: Whenever you take Bog Spice you may suppress all roleplaying effects caused by Marks aligned to "Callista the Bog Witch". If you do not take Bog Spice every hour, gain one level of Toxcity

name: Mark of Transit
roleplaying: You feel that you were never meant to see this world. You find yourself speculating about other paths your life could have taken when alone.
mechanical: While you bear this mark you can give your travel token to another character. They will then be able to use it to pass through the gate as usual. If not used before the next meal it will return to you.
